titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF SENATE AMENDMENT TO HOUSE AMENDMENT TO SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 601, REINFORCING EDUCATION ACCOUNTABILITY IN DEVELOPMENT ACT

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF SENATE AMENDMENT TO HOUSE AMENDMENT TO SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 601, REINFORCING EDUCATION ACCOUNTABILITY IN DEVELOPMENT ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 145

titleInfo.title: REINFORCING EDUCATION ACCOUNTABILITY IN DEVELOPMENT ACT

extension.searchTitle: REINFORCING EDUCATION ACCOUNTABILITY IN DEVELOPMENT ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 145

congVote.result: So the motion to concur was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Reinforcing Education Accountability in Development Act
Reinforcing Education Accountability in Development Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House concurred in the Senate amendment to the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 601, to enhance the transparency and accelerate the impact of assistance provided under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 to promote quality basic education in developing countries, to better enable such countries to achieve universal access to quality basic education and improved learning outcomes, and to eliminate duplication and waste, by a yea-and-nay vote of 316 yeas to 90 nays, Roll No. 480.

The House concurred in the Senate amendment to the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 601, to enhance the transparency and accelerate the impact of assistance provided under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 to promote quality basic education in developing countries, to better enable such countries to achieve universal access to quality basic education and improved learning outcomes, and to eliminate duplication and waste, by a yea-and-nay vote of 316 yeas to 90 nays, Roll No. 480.<P/>H. Res. 509, the rule providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the House amendment to the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 601) was agreed to by voice vote, after the previous question was ordered without objection.

extension.searchTitle: THE JOURNAL; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 145

titleInfo.title: DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR, ENVIRONMENT, AND RELATED AGENCIES APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2018

extension.searchTitle: DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR, ENVIRONMENT, AND RELATED AGENCIES APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2018; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 145

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Department of the Interior, Environment, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2018
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House considered H.R. 3354, making appropriations for the Department of the Interior, environment, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2018. Further proceedings were postponed.<P/>Blackburn amendment (No. 55 printed in H. Rept. 115-297) that was debated on September 7th that sought to call for 1% across the board cuts (by a recorded vote of 156 ayes to 248 noes, Roll No. 481);

congVote.result: So the amendment was agreed to.
